content.text: Digitization and the law. New technologies mean new challenges for law. The Internet is no longer a new territory, critical topics such as cyber attacks, privacy, the protection of minors or cloud computing are not discussed at all. Increasing digitalization and technology is not limited to the World Wide Web. Automated road traffic is an equally forward-looking topic, whose development must be accompanied by legal advice. In this volume, research by legal scientists from Germany, the USA, Canada and Greece is summarized.The series Robotics and Law, edited by Prof. Eric Hilgendorf and Prof. Susanne Beck, is dedicated to the discussion of practical legal questions on robotics, technology and digitalization.With contributions by Prof. Eric Hilgendorf, Prof. Susanne Beck, Prof. Mark Kende, Prof. Ari Ezra Waldman, Prof. Maria Kaiafa-Gbandi, Prof. Sara Sun Beale and Peter Berris, Prof. Frank Peter Schuster
content.title_en: Digitization and the law

content.text: Quantitative approaches in the literary and humanities: systematic and historical perspectives. Since the beginning of the 19th century quantitative methods have been used in the literary and humanities to describe, analyse and interpret texts. Until the end of the 20th century such approaches were underrepresented, but in the course of the digital humanities they are becoming very important. The aim of the volume is to contextualize quantitative methods in theory, methods and subject-historical terms, but also to examine with a view to the digital present what their results are of importance. In view of the innovative verve of digital humanities, it must not be forgotten that the idea of opposing an interpretative close reading to a descriptive-analytic distant reading (meaning?) is not much younger than the idea of close reading itself. Because counting has by no means become conceivable only by the 'digital revolution' of the humanities. Rather, for about 200 years now, what was determined by the late dilthey as the subject of the understanding and qualitatively oriented humanities, has been declared to be 'measureable'.
content.title_en: Quantitative approaches in the literature and humanities : systematic and historical perspectives

content.text: The methodological and conceptual approaches of water education are available, in which places which models are implemented, which is the fascination of water in all its aggregate states for humans. They also practice scientific criticism in the individual disciplines. They convey a current picture of the sciences and their institutions in which women still have to tackle structural disadvantages. - Content: Ströker, Elisabeth: The role of women in the discovery of nuclear fission. - Tollmien, Cordula: "The mother of modern algebra" - The life of the mathematician Emmy Noether (1882-1935). - Oechtering, Veronika: Grace Murray Hopper - The pioneer of computer programming. - Owen, Linda R.: People in the Stone Age - New perspectives of women scientists. - Children's man, Ute: "The Reality" - No problem in the everyday science? content.text: Sustainability in Science : Leopoldina workshop on 12 November 2012 in Berlin. The focus of the worldwide reflections on the challenges of the 21st century is the concept of sustainability. In order to reflect this principle in concrete proposals for action, we need to clarify it. The volume therefore examines sustainability in science, the most important source of information for society. Sustainability of structures as well as activities in research and teaching is considered. The "research of sustainability", which aims to provide strategies for better understanding, the complex "sustainable research", the prerequisites, processes and consequences of research according to the criteria of sustainability, and the "sustainability of research", which examines the essential principles of science - for example the falsification of its results - in the light of the idea of sustainability. The focus of the analysis is on the tension between freedom and sustainability of science and on the one hand, the impact of the debate on the structures of the scientific system.
content.title_en: Sustainability in Science : Leopoldina Workshop on 12 November 2012 in Berlin

content.text: Exhaustive work : Health and prevention in the flexible working world. The new working world is characterized by increasing uncertainty. Discontinuous employment relationships are still on the rise. For employees in the knowledge economy, higher degrees of freedom are associated with this, but also new burdens - up to burnout. In addition, job nomads, freelancers and time workers are often excluded from company health promotion. How and by whom can these groups be supported in health prevention? - The volume sheds light on these questions from various social science perspectives and supports the argumentation with empirical findings. The volume illuminates these questions from various social science perspectives and supports the argumentation with empirical findings.
content.title_en: Exhaustive work : health and prevention in the flexible working environment

content.text: The publication contains the results of the eighth working session of the German-Polish Association (DPAG) of the Academy and an information forum in Warsaw at the end of 1995. The focus is on the expansion of Berlin and its spatial effects for Poland and Germany in Europe. Detailed information is provided on the basics and perspectives of the joint planning of the Berlin-Brandenburg metropolitan area as well as on regional structural change and the possible governance in the region from the perspective of the metropolis of Berlin. From a Polish perspective, the metropolis is examined under political, spatially folderic, economic and social aspects. In addition, considerations on the redesign of the city centre of Berlin as well as the major infrastructure projects of the German capital are presented and discussed as well as the role of Berlin in the system of major German cities are critically reflected. Furthermore, the perspectives for the development of the east-west traffic between Poland and Germany are discussed.
content.title_en: Capital region Berlin-Brandenburg in Polish-German dialogue : [eighth session of DPAG on 18 and 19 September 1995 in Kazimierz Dolny/Weichsel]

content.text: The interdisciplinary perspectives on demographic change are becoming more and more re-thinking. Falling birth rates and an increasing life expectancy are phenomena that can be detected in highly developed industrial societies around the world, which are discussed in conflicting terms in politics, media and sciences: on the one hand, a crisis rhetoric warns against a 'slow', 'grey' society or a 'pensioner democracy' and thus puts the generational conflict at the centre. On the other, an ideal of age is promoted, the activity, self-responsibility and the willingness to 'lifelong learning' is declared desirable and thus directly connected to the discourse of the New Economy. This volume claims to counteract the ideological 'demographization' of social problems and to show ways of thinking about aging not only anew, but also how a self-determined and worthy life (until death) can be shaped.
content.title_en: Rethinking ageing : interdisciplinary perspectives on demographic change

content.text: Monument and Energy 2017 : Energy efficiency, sustainability and user comfort. Contributions by renowned authors explain opportunities and risks in the energetic upgrading of the building envelope and show by means of practical examples successful energetic renovations with respect to the preservation of monuments. Furthermore, detailed considerations on fire protection and economic efficiency as well as the latest findings from research and development are presented. The combination of monument protection and energy efficiency poses a major challenge today's preservation of monuments. In the long term, monuments cannot escape the conflict between energy measures and preservation of original building substance. In the sense of sustainability, it is important to reduce the energy consumption and the emissions of these buildings without significantly changing the appearance of the building substance. However, only if a building monument fulfils a certain user comfort, it can be used and thus preserved for future purposes. The content Buildings and Projects - Design and Construction - Material and Technology - Research and Development The target groups Architects, Engineers, Monument Maintenance and in the field of monument maintenance and renovations active representatives of the public service and of companies. The publisher Prof. Bernhard Weller is Director of the Institute for Construction at the Technical University of Dresden. Dipl.-Ing. Sebastian Horn is Head of Design of the University of Energy Efficiency and Energy Efficiency and Energy Efficiency - Dresden Institute of the Institute of the Institute of the University of Construction and Energy Design.
content.title_en: Monument and Energy 2017 : Energy efficiency, sustainability and user comfort

content.text: Since the 6th Criminal Law Reform Act 1998, there are criminal penalties for carrying out a "dangerous tool". The attempts to interpret the concept of a dangerous tool sufficiently precisely are considered to have failed. However, there are hardly any considerations as to how the "appropriate recasting of the law" suggested by the German Criminal Law Court could take place. The regulatory models in nine countries were compared with the aim of a proper amendment. The comparison is framed by a legal-historical representation of the theft with weapons. The cross-section of the solution is analytically summarized and evaluated by the right-to-right analysis. Reform considerations conclude the collection volume. The editor is the holder of the professorship for criminal law, including European criminal law and international criminal law, at the European University Viadrina in Frankfurt (Oder) with the research focus of the criminal law comparison. With contributions by Isidoro Blanco Cordero, Andreas Eicker, Margareth Helfer, Gudrun Hochmayr, Johannes Keil, Johannes Klawl, Kurtłol, Johannes
content.title_en: Weapons and dangerous tools as a basis for tightening: comparative law and reform

content.text: Information Age Economy : 5th International Conference on Economic Informatics 2001. The use of information and (tele)communication systems for the economy has become an omnipresent phenomenon by the rapid technological progress at the beginning of the 3rd millennium. Among the slogans such as e(lectronic)-, m(obile)-, u(biquitious)-Computing/Commerce, visions of the future are being discussed, which give information and communication systems a central role on the way to the electronic service economy far beyond their current uses. This book looks at this development in all its facets and presents pioneering research and practice work at the interface of modern business economics, economic information technology and applied computer science. It proposes the bridge between science and practice by showing the essential design options and recommendations that pave the way for the enterprises to successfully enter the "Information Age Economy".
content.title_en: Information Age Economy : 5th International Conference on Information Technology 2001

content.text: Parallel data processing with the transputer: 5th TAT `93 Transputer User Meeting, Aachen, 20-22 September 1993. The contributions of the 5th TAT `93 Transputer User Meeting are from industry, research, development and teaching and provide detailed information on the new possibilities of transputer applications and performance enhancements that can be achieved with this parallel computer technology. The topics of this volume are algorithms, neural networks and image and real-time processing. Here it becomes clear that even with relatively small transputer systems it is possible to solve tasks that were previously reserved for large-scale computing systems. Thus, this book offers the beginner an overview of problems that can be successfully processed with the transputer and a wealth of suggestions and solutions using the example of successful transputer applications.
content.title_en: Parallel data processing with the transputer : 5th Transputer User Meeting TAT

content.text: Migration and Building Culture : Transformation of building through individual and collective immigration. Since ancient times migration movements have had a special significance for the change of architecture and technology. These can be triggered by wars, political repression, voluntary decisions or economic pressure. Again and again, cultural overburdens, transformation and displacement processes occur, the results of which illustrate the stability or transformation of a society and its building culture. The publication gathers contributions from archaeology, the history of construction and construction technology, the preservation of monuments and the history of art and architecture. In individual studies, the mechanisms that led to the transformation of building as a result of individual and collective immigration are examined across different periods of time.
content.title_en: Migration and Building Culture : Transformation of Building through Individual and Collective Immigration

content.text: What bits and trees combine: Sustainable design of digitalisation; Bits & trees, the conference for digitalization and sustainability, Technische Universität Berlin in November 2018. The conference »Bits & trees« (2018 in Berlin) has been the largest debate forum for digitalization and sustainability. More than 50 authors from the tech scene, the sustainability movement and development cooperation show in this book of the conference how digitalization can advance social-ecological change. The contributions shed light on the impact of our digital consumption in the global south, the sustainable use of data or the risks and potentials of a digitised economic system. The focus is always on the urgent question: Which digitalization do we want? The various answers to this question make clear: A future-proof digitalisation must be oriented less towards the interests of individual economic actors, but rather towards the common good. Selected contributions from »Bits & trees« numerous infographics and portraits give ideas on how digitalization can make the world better.
content.title_en: What connects bits and trees : Sustainable design of digitalization ; Bits & trees, the conference for digitalization and sustainability, Technische Universität Berlin in November 2018

content.text: Sacred Spaces in Judaism : Festschrift für Salomon Korn. Architektur – Gesellschaft – Religion: These are the coordinates of the Festschrift for the sociologist, architect and chairman of the Frankfurt Jewish Community, Salomon Korn. "Sakrale Raumen im Judik" spans the archetype of the architecture of the temple over temple concepts, virtual sacral spaces, prayer rooms to synagogues from the Middle Ages to classical modernism. The volume gathers contributions to a conference of the same topic from various sub-divisions of the Heidelberg University of Jewish Studies, whose chairman of the board of trustees Salomon Korn was over many years, and includes studies of other researchers on the subject. As a result, he illustrates the surprising breadth of sacred space concepts in Judaism and underlines the Jewish part in the history of European sacred architecture.
content.title_en: Sacred Spaces in Judaism : Festschrift für Salomon Korn

content.text: UK in view : Perspectives on theories and fields of practice in supported communication. Supported communication is no longer a matter of everyday life for many people, regardless of the point of view you look at. The special and valuable thing about UK is precisely characterized by this multifaceted richness: Different professions in the most diverse situations of life affect the different methods in a completely unique way, in order to offer and promote complementary or replacing forms of communication and thus to meet the basic need for communication. The book combines many different points of view, from which can be taken into consideration from UK. Different methods are examined and different tools and approaches are examined. (back page book cover)
content.title_en: UK in view : Perspectives on theories and practice in supported communication

content.text: The contributions of this collection deal with theories and models as well as approaches to the practice of debt prevention and poverty reduction. The authors of contributions investigate how disadvantaged groups of people can be reached, they shed light on the links between poverty, debt and debt prevention and they further explore the communication of financial knowledge and competence for the target group of students and trainees.The book presents the current discourse on the practice of debt prevention in German-speaking countries and gives help to further develop the work on this topic.The content of debt and poverty as the subject of prevention and counselling The theories and concepts of prevention Methodical approaches and innovations Challenges and perspectives of debt prevention The target groups of lecturers and students of education, psychology, sociology and social work Practitioners in social work The editor Dr. Christoph Mattes is a lecturer at the University of Applied Sciences Northwestern Switzerland (FHNWS). His research focuses on poverty, debt, life situations analysis and work of the social policy of the university.
content.title_en: Poverty reduction through debt prevention: empirical findings, methodological approaches and perspectives

content.text: Crisis of the Future II : Responsibility and freedom in the face of apocalyptic scenarios. Current debates of self-conciliation in Western societies are characterized by crisis discourses that often use religious-apocalyptic symbolism. The future, it seems, can, at least in European discourses, often only be thought in the mode of the catastrophy. Such a thinking of the future has an impact on current action and challenges our traditional ethical guiding concepts. Who can take responsibility for the future if the catastrophe seems inevitable?This volume gathers the contributions of the interdisciplinary final conference of the Research College "The Crisis of the Future" of the Centre for Religion, Economics and Politics (ZRWP) Basel. The texts deal ethically with the questions that bring about current forms of future discourse.
content.title_en: Crisis of the Future II : Responsibility and Freedom in the Face of Apocalyptic Scenarios

content.text: Everyday and transition practices in support of young people: Between self-determination, attachment and societal adaptation demands. Help for young people must be designed in such a way that they have a good chance at the end of the day being able to live a self-determined life. What does everyday life in stationary aid institutions look like in order to achieve this goal? How can transitions be measured by different perspectives? What social and legal policy decisions are necessary? In this volume, everyday and transitional practices in different help systems for young people are exposed from different perspectives. Help for young people must be designed in such a way that they can ultimately have a good chance to live independently. How must everyday life look at stationary help institutions so that this goal is achieved? How can transitions be meaningfully shaped by different perspectives? Help for young people must be designed in such a way that they can ultimately have a good chance of self-determined life.
content.title_en: Practices in everyday and transitional situations in support of young people: Between self-determination, attachment and societal adaptation requirements

content.text: Events and trade fairs in the digital age: current status and perspectives. The authors of the conference volume discuss the influence of digitalization on live communication and provide explanatory approaches for the successful use of digital technologies in the event and trade fair industry. The volume summarizes the current research results presented and discussed at the 11th scientific conference Event Research, which took place on 25.10.2019 at the TU Chemnitz, on the topic of events and trade fairs in the digital age. The focus is on practical contributions, among others, on the use of marketing automation tools in agency practice or on the current state of use of event apps in the context of events and trade fairs. The content of virtual and augmented reality in the Live Communication Self-Service Technologies at events and trade fairs Marketing automation in the event and trade fair sector The target groups Dozierende und Studieren der Wirtschaftswissenschaften with the focus on marketing, sales and communication Fach- und Führungsführer aus den Wissenschaftsvermanagement und Messesverwalung as well as marketing The editor Prof. Dr. Cornelia Zanger was the holder of the Chair for marketing and commercial administration of the University of Chemnitz University of Technology.
content.title_en: Events and trade fairs in the digital age : current state and perspectives

content.text: "The changing relationship between early modern astronomy and physics and its denominational manifestations in particular forms the starting point of the volume. Against this background, the collected contributions take into account the corresponding processes linked to the change of the world picture, based on the paradigm shift in early modern science cultures that tends towards trans-confessionality. In this context, the world, whose images undergo a change, offers the natural sciences that drive change, and the the theologies that have passed away from the former certainties about God and the world, and the life and natural research in the early modern era decisively determined, a grateful area for an inter-confessional comparative investigation of confessional specificities."-- Publisher's website
content.title_en: To believe one another - to research one another? : Paradigm change in early modern science cultures

content.text: Documentation as a pastoral task: electronic patient dossiers in the context of Spiritual Care. In clinical pastoral care, it is increasingly practice that the pastoral care workers document their work digitally, make it interprofessionally accessible and record it for various purposes. But what are the possibilities and limits of such documentation? In the German-speaking area, this topic is being investigated within the framework of a National Fund project and for the first time comprehensively discussed: Basic considerations are complemented by practical-theological, ethical and legal perspectives as well as by those from the concrete medical and nursing practice. Not least, practical-theological questions are addressed: How is the pastoral care secret to be documented in interprofessional terms? What concrete documentation practices are developing? Many questions connected with this complex and new topic, such as data protection, are being discussed in detail.
content.title_en: Documentation as pastoral task : electronic patient dossiers in the context of Spiritual Care

content.text: At the same time, the atmosphere is becoming increasingly difficult to understand, and the atmosphere is becoming increasingly difficult to understand. In the process of constant human activity, the atmosphere is becoming increasingly difficult to understand. In the context of climate change and global pandemic, space technologies, and toxic gas warfare, air is being co-created and manipulated by humans. In this spectrum, the breath itself is a difficult but essential substance to grasp, which makes connections between physical, symbolic, technological and social issues visible. For the existence of constant change and crossing of borders between the organism and its environment - air as an «immaterial» material becomes active. For the existence of the atmosphere and the environment.
content.title_en: Breath. Design, ecological and social dimensions

content.text: Dangerous research? : A debate on equality and difference in science. This volume examines the influence of scientific innovations such as artificial intelligence on everyday life. Thus, the relationship between science and the public is illuminated in the aspects of the responsibility of scientists, the application of innovations in public life and the perception of these innovations in public life. This volume examines the influence that scientific innovations like artificial intelligence are having on everyday life. By looking at issues like the responsibility of scientists, the application of innovations in public life, and the perception of these innovations in the public sphere, it shines light on the relationship between science and the public sphere
content.title_en: Dangerous research? : A debate on equality and difference in science

content.text: In spite of some intensive discussions, there is no final nomenclature for the concepts of digital transformation and sustainability in the financial sector. This volume deals with opportunities and risks from these two topics and their interaction, and focuses on both the global financial economy and the core aspects of financial activities in companies. With contributions by Eduard Bossauer, Prof. Dr. Alexander Brink, Prof. Dr. Michel Charifzadeh, Prof. Dr. Martina Sageder, Selina Somogyi, Jona Stinner, Marcel Tyrell, Jens Wiedra, Prof. Dr. Michael Kuttner, Prof. Dr. Christine Mitter, Maurice Niklos, Prof. Dr. Martina Sageder, Selina Somogyi, Jona Stinner, Jens Wiedra, Prof. Konrad Wtimmer and Markus Wimciven in the following.
content.title_en: Digital transformation and sustainability in the global financial sector

content.text: Artificial Intelligence, Democracy and Privatity. This volume contains selected contributions from the annual conference of the Forum Privatity, 2021. It analyses the current challenges that arise from the development of artificial intelligence (AI) for privacy, informational self-determination, and democracy and how these can be addressed by governance mechanisms. The contributions focus on AI's use for profiling and monitoring, on issues of dissemination and discovery of disinformation by AI, as well as on the use of AI in the health and care sector. This volume contains selected papers from the 2021 annual conference affiliated to ‘Forum Privatity, which analysis the current challenges posed by the development of artificial intelligence (AI) to privacy, informational self-determination and democracy, and how they can be addressed through governance measures. The contributions focus on the use of AI through the identification of the identification of the disease and disease.
content.title_en: Artificial intelligence, democracy and privacy

content.text: Variants of change: the region in recent history 1970-2020. It may be surprising that "big processes" such as globalisation or digitalization have once again brought the region into the focus of historical interest. But here, the social changes "after the boom" were indeed the most evident. Given the transformative quality of these years, research now distinguishes winners and losers, referring to serious regional differences. The authors of the volume take this as an opportunity to examine a number of different regional topics more closely and to elaborate special "variants of change" since 1970. It is evident that acute need for action below the national level was usually recognized early and the social groups and actors on the ground proved to be the real designers of change. However, the regions were always affected to a varying extent due to their respective dispositions and potentials and therefore suggested very specific development paths in many cases.
content.title_en: Variants of change: the region in recent history 1970-2020

content.text: After the Roman Empire, the buildings were used for the trade and money traffic, ranging from storage buildings in important economic centres and port locations to bank and stock exchange buildings in the central squares of the cities. These buildings were often examined by archaeologists and building historians, with the emphasis on design and design. Economic historians were intensively involved in trade and money transactions without having to consider the connection with building matters. Interdisciplinary cooperation opens up new perspectives. With the knowledge of economic processes, buildings can be better understood, and buildings can make visible economic processes. This became clear at the first exchange of ideas between the various research disciplines. The present conference volume contains contributions on trade forms and trade relations, he presents storage buildings and merchant houses and illuminates with the Magdalensberg in Carinthia a significant center of ore extraction and metal processing. The Roman Basilica takes a special place as a great development building of the Roman Empire and a forum of its counter-concepts, the latter of the Roman Empire's new architectural law.
content.title_en: Economic buildings in the ancient city : International Colloquium, 16 - 17 November 2012, Karlsruhe

content.text: Developments in Europe : Consequences for the development of Bavaria. The volume contains eight papers presented at the 17th seminar for regional planners in Bavaria in October 1994, dealing with the current situation of the development of Bavaria (1994) and the global and European economic structural changes. They show the reactions in spatial planning to the new challenges and demonstrate the need, but also the limitations, for coordinated European spatial planning.
content.title_en: Developments in Europe: Consequences for the development of Bavaria

content.text: To be seen: queer lives 1900-1950. The contributions collected in the volume represent the history of queer life plans - from the first emancipation movements around the turn of the century, to attempts at self-empowerment in the Weimar Republic, to the destruction of queer subcultures under the National Socialist regime and the continuing discrimination against LGBTIQ people in the post-war period. Since the late 19th century, more and more people have been confidently advocating the recognition of queer lifestyles. These pioneers formed collectives, gained their hearing and questioned dominant gender categories politically, scientifically and artistically. In the form of essays, interviews and works of art, authors and artists have been investigating this struggle for recognition, which was violently suppressed, destroyed and remembered by the National Socialists with the takeover of power after 1945.
content.title_en: To be seen : queer lives 1900-1950

content.text: Diversity and representation : Affiliation and exclusion in the literary museum and in literary studies. The analysis and teaching of literary texts of the early 19th century has a wide range of potentials for dealing with diversity, belonging and exclusion. The contributors ask how cultural diversity in the museum and literature and educational practice leads to critical reflections and new perspectives on canonized objects. The focus is on the options for the representation of diversity in the literary museum and in literary studies. In addition, they bring together theoretical and practical accesses and develop a new methodological-theoretical diversity.
content.title_en: Diversity and representation : membership and exclusion in the literary museum and in literary studies

content.text: Resilience as a success factor in tourism : Contributions from science and practice to the development of destinations. This is an open access book. Resilience is one of the central topics of the future in tourism today. Under the conditions of persistent crises and rapid change processes, issues of resistance and adaptability have become increasingly central. This innovative volume examines what distinguishes more resilient destinations and tourist actors more precisely and how the necessary transformation of the industry succeeds. In addition to current practical insights from different regions, relevant topics are addressed, such as: - the role of diversity, - resilience in destination management, - the importance of citizen participation, - the consideration of the perceptions of the local population and - resilience in wine and hiking tourism. An exciting source of inspiration for a key topic of the tourism industry, which was created in the context of the "5th Deidesheimer Talks on Tourism Science".
content.title_en: Resilience as a success factor in tourism : Contributions from science and practice to the development of destinations

content.text: The state of implementation of resource protection in Lower Saxony and Schleswig-Holstein, from the state and regional planning to the municipal level, is discussed from a storage and raw material economic and planning point of view. Weaknesses in the raw material analysis as well as in the planning of the respective area identification (pre-primary, precautionary and reserve areas) are shown. The existing instrument of the regional planning is sufficient. However, the awareness of what binding planning requirements are and where discretionary possibilities lie is not sufficiently pronounced. The trustful cooperation of all parties involved in resource protection is necessary to meet both the nature and environmental protection as well as the supply of the economy with the necessary mineral raw materials.
content.title_en: Instruments of regional planning and planning for the conservation of raw materials in the countries of Bremen, Hamburg, Lower Saxony and Schleswig-Holstein

content.text: Joint objectives : Evaluation, Quality Assurance and Accreditation in Germany and Mongolia ; Seminar of the Rectors' Conference with representatives of the Rectors' Council of Mongolia, Bonn, 14-15 December 1998 ; [this publication was published as part of the project Quality Assurance]. This seminar was organized as part of the project Quality Assurance. Included are the following contributions: Künzel, Rainer: Opening and Welcome. - Lange, Josef: Aktuelle Fragen der Hochschulpolitik in Deutschland. - Schreier, Gerhard: Evaluation and Quality Assurance in Germany - an overview. - Hennen, Manfred: Evaluationsverfahren an der Universität Mainz. - Burmaa, S.: Qualitätsverfahrung in Hochschulen der Mongolia. - Reuke, Hermann: Externe Evaluation - Organisation, Procedures und Erfahrungen. - Barz, Andreas: Folgen von Evaluation (HoF/Text übernahmen)
content.title_en: Common objectives : Evaluation, quality assurance and accreditation in Germany and Mongolia ; Seminar of the Rectors' Conference with representatives of the Rectors' Council of Mongolia, Bonn, 14-15 December 1998 ; [This publication was published in the context of the project Quality Assurance]

content.text: The new century: European time diagnoses and future designs around 1900. This volume looks at Europe-wide discussions and controversy around 1900. The contributions take into account the international dimension of these debates and focus on those topics that contemporaries already paid special attention to and which were of prominent importance for the history of the 20th century. These included war and peace scenarios, the scientific resonation about a "new person", the perspectives of economics and technology, cultural and artistic locational regulations and future designs, the expectations of a new gender order as well as the development of industrial class society. These topics are examined from different locations: from the perspective of social movements as well as from political classes, scientists or professional groups. "Public opinion" of the turn of the century thus ranges into various actors and discutants. The book reconstructs a fascinating panorama image of European public opinion - a panoramic image in which experiences of the past merge with expectations of the future, in which fears, distortions and expanses are likewise abolished as well as hopes, desires and wishes of the university.
content.title_en: The New Century : European Time Diagnoses and Futures around 1900

content.text: Social exclusion through inclusion: prison and criminal assistance between restriction and resocialization. The combination of a tightening criminal policy and restrictive social policy, as it is currently staged, has a rather integrated character in its interaction with social marginal groups. In connection with increasing poverty, social exclusion has become an important issue in recent years. An increasing number of long-term unemployed, the precarious living conditions of migrants in the metropolises, the increasing poverty among young people, all this points to social situations which are substantiated by the concept of social exclusion. The logic of such social processes: the less competitive, the socially vulnerable, the less vulnerable and the more economically and socially vulnerable, the greater the risk of social exclusion of morally degraded persons or groups. A group that combines several characteristics of this is that of the people who have become ill-off.
content.title_en: Social exclusion by inclusion : prison and help between restriction and resocialization

content.text: From hand-to-hand to high-tech : measure, model, represent ; recording methods in historical building research ; interdisciplinary colloquium from 23 - 26 February 2000. From hand-to-hand to high-tech - in this field of tension the current discussion about methods and procedures of building reception in building research, archaeology and preservation of monuments moves. Latest surveying methods, 3D models or virtual reality offer new opportunities for surveying and presentation of buildings, ruins or entire urban facilities. At the same time, many objects require an intensive study on site, which can not only be realized with the traditional methods of hand-to-hand measurement. - In over 30 contributions, in which the interdisciplinary discussion of a colloquium conducted at the Technical University of Cottbus is summarized, potentials and limits of the different methods are clearly presented.The volume includes 38 contributions of a colloquium in the University of Cottbus. The new technical possibilities of measuring on computer programs, 3-D representations and many other new methods have also been extensively used in the field of archaeological surveying and building drawings as well as in the preservation of monuments. The volume of the practical methods is strongly influenced by the state-to-level analysis.
content.title_en: From manual to high tech : measuring, modelling, representing ; admission procedures in historical building research ; interdisciplinary colloquium of 23-26 February 2000

content.text: Cork: History, Architecture, Design 1750 - 2002; [for the special exhibition "Totally Corked?!" Cork: History, Architecture, Design 1750 - 2002 of the museums of the city of Delmenhorst on the North wool from 16.6. to 15.9.2002]. For centuries the constantly renewing bark of cork oaks has been supplying precious material in the countries around the Mediterranean, for example bottle corks. However, the commercial cradle of cork processing has been located in the north-west of Germany since the mid-18th century, around and in the city of Delmenhorst. Since that time, the so-called "propane down" mainly cork grafts have been shipped to wine dealers all over the world. Cork has been used in an incredible variety in architecture, design and fashion since the 18th century: cork has been used as a high-quality insulation material in house construction since ancient times; also as a floor covering, cork is pure or as a major component of linoleum. Less known is the fact that cork has been used for architectural model construction in Italy and Germany since the 18th century as a modern cork industry.
content.title_en: Cork : History, Architecture, Design 1750 - 2002 ; [for the special exhibition "Totally Corked?!" Cork: History, Architecture, Design 1750 - 2002 of the museums of the city of Delmenhorst on the North wool from 16.6. to 15.9.2002]

content.text: The fullness of the beautiful : Harz garden landscape; [on the occasion of the special exhibition of the Schloß Wernigerode GmbH; Frühlingsbau Schloß Wernigerode, September 12, 2002 - February 2, 2003]. The spectrum of the volume ranges from the medieval monastery garden to the Mannerist garden of the late Renaissance, the formal baroque park, the sentimental landscape garden, the classic English landscape park, the 19th century spa park, the Art Nouveau garden and the garden in the architectural tradition of the early 20th century. - 40 exemplary park and garden facilities are presented in detail. They are scattered throughout the entire area of the Harz and are selected according to their historical significance.
content.title_en: Fill of beauty : Garden landscape Harz ; [on the occasion of the special exhibition of the Schloß Wernigerode GmbH ; Spring construction Schloß Wernigerode, 12 September 2002 - 2 February 2003]

content.title_en: Machine, monument, landmark : historical mills - conflict over a monument genus ; conference of the BTU Cottbus, 26-27 October 2001

content.text: Current tasks for regional and regional planning in Bavaria: 23rd seminar for regional and regional planners in Bavaria. The 23rd seminar for regional and regional planners in Bavaria deals with various aspects that have become increasingly important for planning and will grow even further. The first key word is Europe, whose further growth must also affect regional and regional planning. Especially at regional level, it is challenges, such as large retail projects or wind energy use and finally social change, which requires more cooperation and cooperation also at regional level. On the one hand, new 'soft' planning instruments play an important role and on the other hand, changes in communication networks based on modern ICT technology. The volume gives a section from the current discussion about the task and solutions of current regional and regional planning.
content.title_en: Current tasks for regional and regional planning in Bavaria : 23rd seminar for regional and regional planners in Bavaria

content.text: The Colour White: Colour Rausch and Colour Distinction in Architecture; [as catalogue of the exhibition "The Colour White - Colour Rausch and Colour Distinction in Architecture", April 27 - June 22, 2003, Stadthaus Ulm]. Ten years after the completion of the Stadthaus, the building planned by Richard Meier itself was the focus of an exhibition. The focus was on a specificity of Meier's architecture, the emphatically presented white. Meier's design was based on the architecture of modernism around 1930. Here, the white was associated with objectivity and clarity. It represented the liberation from the fetters of history, from the outdated pathos of the (coloured) founding era. - - At the very least since the early Renaissance, the colour was used in the architecture programmatically. The exhibition depicted the change of views based on selected graphics, paintings and architectural models, with the focus on the 19th and 20th centuries of the architects, while the works of Hermann Scharbruch were made possible by Hermann Schirt.
content.title_en: The Colour White : Color Rausch and Color Rausch in Architecture ; [as catalogue for the exhibition "The Colour White - Color Rausch and Color Rausch in Architecture", April 27 - June 22, 2003, Stadthaus Ulm]

content.title_en: The education of the future

content.text: Broadband perspectives: fast access to innovative applications; with 137 illustrations and 7 tables; [Specialized conference "Broadband Perspectives - Fast Access to Innovative Applications" of the Munich district]. Worldwide, the expansion of telecommunications networks to a broadband infrastructure is in full swing. DSL is the backbone of fast Internet access in many countries. TV cables are increasingly also used for fast Internet access. For mobile participants, wireless access technologies provide complementary solutions. DAB and DVB are used for the transmission of content and data; for the cellular systems of the third generation as well as for the wireless LANs, the non-voice services are in the foreground. The questions are: How does broadband pay off? What do business models look like? Who finances the expansion of the infrastructure? The Munich district has carried out a critical inventory of the worldwide efforts. Supported by high-ranking experts, the current developments and the future perspectives were analysed.
content.title_en: Broadband perspectives : fast access to innovative applications ; with 137 illustrations and 7 tables ; [Conference on "Broadband Perspectives - Fast access to innovative applications" by the Munich district]

content.text: Stereospecific polymerization and stereoregular polymers : [International Symposium on "Stereospecific Polymerization and Strereoregular Polymers", EUPOC 2003] ; Milan, Italy, June 8 - 12, 2003. EUPOC 2003, the European Polymer Conference on "Stereospecific Polymerization and Stereoregular Polymers", which took place in Milan, Italy, was organized to celebrate the 100th birthday of Giulio Natta, who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1963 together with Karl Ziegler
content.title_en: Stereospecific polymerization and stereoregular polymers: [International Symposium on "Stereospecific Polymerization and Strereoregular Polymers", EUPOC 2003] ; Milan, Italy, June 8 - 12, 2003

content.text: Altar Room as a community space : Redesign of existing churches; [a symposium organized at the Catholic-Theological Private University Linz in May 2003]. The transformation of existing churches, especially altar room arrangements, is now the most common undertaking of church construction activities, following the boom of the new buildings from the post-war period to the 1980s. Despite new insights into historical spatial situations and new liturgical theological considerations, the new challenge for the communities, theological basic views and pastoral requirements remains to be adequately transformed into a spatial design. A symposium organized in May 2003 at the Catholic-Theological Private University Linz/Donau brought together experts from the fields of architecture, monument preservation, art, liturgy and pastoral activities.
content.title_en: Altar Room as a community room : Redesign of existing churches; [a symposium organized at the Catholic-Theological Private University Linz in May 2003]

content.text: Reform of accounting and corporate governance in Germany and Europe. With contributions by: Norbert Breker, Kai-Uwe Marten, M. Felix Weiser, Karl Ernst Knorr, Michael Krall, Robert Winnefeld, Martin Künnemann, Hans Friedrich Gelhausen, Ulrich Seibert
content.title_en: Reform of accounting and corporate governance in Germany and Europe

content.text: Europe on the road to the most competitive and dynamic economic area in the world? : an interim review of the Lisbon Strategy. On 4 and 5 December 2003, the Hamburg World Economic Archive (HWWA) and the Working Group on European Integration jointly organised an interdisciplinary conference on European economic and economic policy in Hamburg. (Information from the Preface)
content.title_en: Europe on the road to the most competitive and dynamic economy in the world?: an interim review of the Lisbon Strategy

content.text: Higher Education didactic qualification : strategies and concepts in an international comparison. The high debt didactic qualification is now an international standard. More and more countries, whose main resource is education, rely on the didactic qualification of their teaching staff. The volume describes the international status: current country examples show the far-reaching changes in this area. In Germany, especially study programmes, networks and increasingly modularized programmes of high debt didactic institutions take an important place.
content.title_en: Educational qualification : strategies and concepts in an international comparison

content.text: Berlin - Innovations for the restructuring case. With contributions by Harald Wolf, Klaus Brake, Kurt Geppert, Martin Gornig, Peer Pasternack, Volkmar Strauch, Dieter Scholz, Vincent-Winnetou Sosa, Benjamin-Immanuel Hoff, Ines Wallrodt, Thomas Langeheiniken, Christian Kilger, Raphael Jung, Christian Meyer zu Schwabedissen, Ursula Westphal, Heidi Knake-Werner, Hermann Schulte-Sasse, Hans Jochen Brauns and others
content.title_en: Berlin - Innovations for the restructuring case

content.text: Consumption. Globalization. Environment : McPlanet.com ; the book on the second congress of Attac, BUND and Greenpeace. Stand at the 1st McPlanet Congress of Attac, BUND, Greenpeace, Heinrich Böll Foundation and Wuppertal Institute the environment (documented in "The Environment in the Globalization Trap", VSA 2003, not displayed here) in the center, so the 2nd congress of June 2005 documented here dominated the topic "Consum". The volume contains 27 different weighty contributions with a very wide spectrum, from "Consum and Sustainability - a Chinese View", to "WTO Rules and Millennium Development Goals" - and "Fishing in Ghana then and today" to "Justice, Democracy and Consumer Power" and ends with the sympathetic call "More Life, Less Buying". The many scattered photos from the congress events additionally loosen up the book. But a register would have done well in terms of the diversity of topics. (3)
content.title_en: Consumption. Globalization. Environment : McPlanet.com ; the book on the second congress of Attac, BUND and Greenpeace ...

content.text: "Cities for All" - about visionary and feasible urban development: Martin Neuffer and Rudolf Koldewey; Documentation of the symposium on 20 June 2005 in Hanover. In June 2005, the symposium took place to honour the two Upper Town Directors Martin Neuffer and Rudolf Koldewey of the state capital Hanover. Martin Neuffer's visionary ideas and development opportunities ("Cities for All-Design of a Urban Policy" as the programmatic title of one of his books) and the rather sober and pragmatic thinking and action of Rudolf Koldewey represented the mental tension in which the individual contributions of this documentation are located. As a result, the current challenges of urban development and urban development in the context of the major changes in the urban development policy framework from the point of view of municipal politics, urban research, planning administration and administrative modernization become clear.
content.title_en: "Cities for All" - about visionary and feasible urban development : Martin Neuffer and Rudolf Koldewey ; Documentation of the symposium on 20.06.2005 in Hannover

content.text: Transgenerational transmission of war-affected childhoods: interdisciplinary studies on the sustainability of historical experiences over four generations. For the first time, the transgenerational context of war childhoods is systematically investigated in the combination of contemporary history, psychosomatics/psychoanalysis as well as child and youth psychotherapy and psychiatry. Today's historical research looks at the causes of the Second World War and its effects. This perspective is also offered for the research of war childhoods. For the first time, the transgenerational context of war childhoods is systematically investigated in the combination of contemporary history, psychosomatics/psychoanalysis as well as child and youth psychotherapy and psychiatry. Today's historical research sees the causes of the Second World War in connection with the First World War and its effects. Such a perspective also offers for the research of war childhoods. The contributions clearly and sustainably illustrated our current limited level of knowledge and the resulting research desiderata. It is clear that from the first war-affected generation (the First World War) to the grandchildren of war childhoods, the effects of the four generations of the tradivisions of the tradivisions of the tradivisional generation, the tradivisions of the tradivisions of the tradivisions of the tradivisions of the tradivisions of the tradivisions of the tradivisions of the tradivisions of the tradivision of the tradivision of the traditions of the traditions of the traditions of the traditions of the traditions of the traditions of the traditions of the traditions of the two generations.
content.title_en: Transgenerational transmission of war-stricken childhoods : interdisciplinary studies on the sustainability of historical experiences over four generations

content.text: The human right to education and its implementation in Germany: Diagnoses - Reflections - Perspectives. The eleven authors agree that education is crucially decisive about life chances and the conviction that educational justice is to be achieved. Their research aims to systematically establish the human right to education and to formulate the standards for political implementation in an educational social policy.
content.title_en: Human right to education and its implementation in Germany : Diagnoses - Reflections - Perspectives

content.text: The media of architecture: an exhibition of the A:AI Archive for Architecture and Engineering Art NRW; [21 November to 7 December 2007, Rudolf Chaudoire-Pavillon, Campus Süd, Technical University Dortmund]. Those who listen to architecture think of buildings. But as much as we are surrounded by buildings as we are everyday, buildings that concern us are very rare for us. They are usually taught us in a wide range of ways: through images, models, texts and other ways of representation. As little as the physical existence of buildings can be denied, no building without media can be created, used and understood. This was the subject of an exhibition at the Faculty of Construction at TU Dortmund, which was prepared and organized with students. The range of architectural representation was presented using selected pieces from the holdings of the A:AI Archive for Architecture and Engineering Art NRW. Even if not according to construction projects, but according to media, sketches, plans, perspectives, detailed drawings, static calculations, models, photos, films, texts and publications were presented.
content.title_en: The media of architecture : an exhibition of the A:AI Archive for Architecture and Engineering Engineering NRW ; [November 21 to December 7, 2007, Rudolf Chaudoire-Pavilion, Campus Süd, Technische Universität Dortmund]

content.text: Karawane der Hoffnung : mit dem Islam gegen den Pain und die Schweilung ; mit den aktuelle Ergebnisse der TARGET-Geschlehrtenkonferenz in Kairo. With their human rights organization TARGET and the Pro-Islamischen Allianz Rüdiger Nehberg and Annette Weber fight against the barbarism of women's circumcision. The >> caravan of hope < < succeeds: Sultane and Sheikhs follow Nehberg's vision and declare the cruel custom of sin. For many girls begins a new future. The impressive balance of TARGET, crowned by a conference with the highest-ranking Muslim scholars in Cairo. With their human rights organization TARGET and the Pro-Islamischen Allianz, Rüdiger Nehberg and Annette Weber fight against the barbarism of women's circumcision. The ?Karawane der Hoffnung? succeeds: Sultane and Sheikhs follow Nehberg's vision and declare the cruel custom of sin. For many girls a new future begins. The impressive balance of TARGET, crowned by a conference with the highest ranking Muslim scholars in Cairo, the world.
content.title_en: Caravan of Hope : with Islam against pain and silence ; with the current results of the TARGET-Chorizon in Cairo

content.text: The "Schlossbau in der zweiten Half des 15. Jahrhunderts in Mitteldeutschland" (Schlossbau in the second half of the 15th century in Mitteldeutschland) was held at Schloss Sachsenburg. Since 2002, studies on the history of the building have been carried out at Schloss Sachsenburg near Frankenberg/Sa. The very important findings obtained have led to the presentation of a symposium on the construction of the castle in the second half of the 15th century in Mitteldeutschland. This also enabled the presentation of the research results achieved in numerous other Middle German castles. This volume presents the contributions of the most renowned scientists researching the topic.
content.title_en: Castle construction of late Gothic in Central Germany : Conference volume ; [from 20 to 22 October 2006 the symposium "Castle construction in the second half of the 15th century in Central Germany" took place at Schloss Sachsenburg ...]

content.text: Regional and Regional Planning in Baden-Württemberg : an interim assessment on the occasion of the 100th session of the Baden-Württemberg LAG; [joint event of the ARL and the Baden-Württemberg Ministry of Economics on 10 July 2008 at the Haus der Wirtschaft Stuttgart]. In 2008 the Baden-Württemberg Regional Labour Association of the Academy of Spatial Research and Planning will hold its 100th session. This volume, published on the occasion of this anniversary, will draw an interim assessment of the development of regional and regional planning in Baden-Württemberg and present the work, development and essential characteristics of the Baden-Württemberg Regional Labour Community.
content.title_en: Regional and Regional Planning in Baden-Württemberg : an interim assessment at the 100th meeting of the LAG Baden-Württemberg; [joint event of the ARL and the Ministry of Economics Baden-Württemberg on 10 July 2008 at the House of Economics Stuttgart]

content.text: Public financial flows and spatial development: [scientific plenary session 2008]. With the topic "Public financial flows and spatial development" the Academy of Spatial Research and Planning (ARL) addresses questions whose far-reaching and lasting political significance is uncontroversial and whose daily appearance is always in the foreground of public interest. Spatial effects are derived from all fiscal policies, including those which do not have an explicit spatial development policy objective. Nevertheless, the spatial implications of financial policy decisions are often not included in the political decision-making processes and spatial consequences of political decisions are not sufficiently analysed and evaluated systematically. In this context, the present volume offers exemplary studies and regionalized analyses as well as theoretical considerations on the spatial effects of public funding and use in a wide range of current economic and financial policy areas. With this publication, the ARL pursues the goal in the intersection between spatial research and financial science to promote scientific and political discourse and to restrict both.
content.title_en: Public financial flows and spatial development : [2008 Scientific Plenary Session]

content.text: Martin Elsaesser and Neue Frankfurt: [in the context of "Phänomen Expressionismus 2009 - 2011 - ein Projekt des Kulturfonds FrankfurtRheinMain" ; on the occasion of the exhibition "Martin Elsaesser und das Neue Frankfurt" (10 October 2009 - 14 March 2010), organized by the German Architecture Museum, Department of Culture and Science, City of Frankfurt am Main]. The accompanying book for the exhibition at the Deutsche Architekturmuseum Frankfurt am Main from 10 October 2009 to 31 January 2010. - - The publication takes on a double role: it accompanies an exhibition and documents in detail the architect's works that remained as project during his time as artistic director of the Hochbauamt in Frankfurt between 1925 and 1932. Moreover, it deepens aspects such as Elsaesser's difficult role as a leading co-designer of the Neue Frankfurt and the economic, political and personal conditions of his term of office. The book also approaches the teacher and (family) person Elsaesser and undertakes excursions in other creative phases of the construction artist, who has left a rich work before and few prominent buildings after the Frankfurt phase. The modernist's approach to the interpretation of his work is widely reheard in 1925.
content.title_en: Martin Elsaesser and the Neue Frankfurt : [in the context of "Phänomen Expressionismus 2009 - 2011 - a project of the Kulturfonds FrankfurtRheinMain" ; on the occasion of the exhibition "Martin Elsaesser and the Neue Frankfurt" (10 October 2009 - 14 March 2010), organized by the German Architecture Museum, Department of Culture and Science, City of Frankfurt am Main]

content.text: Myth Monument : urban strategies in architecture and art since 1945; [goes back to an international conference held in January 2010 at the Kunsthistorisches Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum under the title "Mythos Monument. Urban strategies in architecture and art since 1945"]. The reflection of the monumental is a central theme of architecture as well as of art after 1945. On the one hand, this is evidenced by the attempts to renew modern architecture by means of a new understanding of concepts. On the other hand, art has been characterized by the desire to comment on or deconstruct the monumental self-understanding of architecture since the 1960s at the latest. - - The volume shows how architecture and art enter into a complex dialogue in this way, which can be observed on different levels: from the immediate confrontation in urban space through the conception of utopian places and antimonuments to the critical commentary of destroyed or reconstructed buildings and monuments.
content.title_en: Myth Monument : Urban Strategies in Architecture and Art since 1945; [goes back to an international conference held in January 2010 at the Kunstgeschichtliches Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum under the title "Mythos Monument. Urban Strategies in Architecture and Art since 1945"]

content.text: B1-A40 - the beauty of the big road: a project in the urban space of the A40 from Duisburg to Dortmund, 12.06.2010 - 08.08.2010 ; Atelier van Lishout; Finger ... ; [on the occasion of the exhibition "B1-A40 The beauty of the big road. A project in the urban space of the A40 from Duisburg to Dortmund"]. Due to its all-day closure in July, the motorway A 40 became probably the largest media event of the European Capital of Culture RUHR.2010. The exhibition "B1-A40 - The beauty of the big road" reflects, as the A 40 in a unique reversal from the periphery to the centre, becoming the central boulevard of the Ruhr metropolis with its over six million inhabitants. Schrebergartenen and shopping miles, cultural production and shadow economy - they all use the "big road" as a platform, node, infrastructure. This situation offers the possibility to examine urgent questions of the "Urban Age" on site: how do spaces generate themselves beyond targeted planning and use interests? And what distinguishes these - for planning and politics largely invisible spaces - are presented by artists, scientists, planning and planaries and new conditions?
content.title_en: B1-A40 - the beauty of the big road : a project in the city area of the A40 from Duisburg to Dortmund, 12.06.2010 - 08.08.2010 ; Atelier van Lishout; Finger ... ; [on the occasion of the exhibition "B1-A40 The beauty of the big road. A project in the city area of the A40 from Duisburg to Dortmund"]

In cooperation with industry partners, the Hasso Plattner Institute (HPI) is establishing a -HPI Future SOC Lab, which provides a complete infrastructure of highly complex on-demand systems on the latest, market-ready, massively parallel (multi-/many-core) hardware with enormous main storage capacities and software designed for it. The HPI Future SOC Lab has prototypical 4- and 8-way Intel 64-bit server systems from Fujitsu and Hewlett-Packard with 32- and 64-core and 1 - 2 TB main storage systems. Highly-performing storage systems from EMC2 and virtualization solutions from VMware are still being used. SAP provides its latest Business by Design (ByD) software and complex real company data are also available for the project's research projects. Interested scientists from university and non-university research institutions can use this event to investigate future-complex IT systems.
content.title_en: Proceedings of the Fall 2010 Future SOC Lab Day

content.text: Networking as a social and technical paradigm: [this volume gathers contributions to an interfaculty symposium organized by the editors of the book in April 2009 under the title "Networking as a social and technical paradigm at the Alpen- Adria-Universität in Klagenfurt]. The newer information and communication technologies are characterized by increasingly networked, decentralized structures. At the same time, networking in the sense of decentralized and flexible systems is also an increasingly important metaphor for social organizational processes. In this volume, which includes both social and technological perspectives, the links between technical and social network concepts are investigated and their reciprocal influence is examined.
content.title_en: Networking as a social and technical paradigm: [this volume gathers contributions to an interfaculty symposium organized by the editors of the book in April 2009 under the title "Networking as a social and technical paradigm" at the Alpine Adriatic University in Klagenfurt]

content.text: Land use monitoring IV: more accurate data - informed actors - practical action ; [... contributions of the now 4th Dresden Land Use Symposium, which took place from 14 to 15 June 2012 ...]. The topics of land use development and reliable land use monitoring, taking into account the objectives of a sustainable land use policy, are becoming increasingly important for policy, spatial planning and environmental protection in view of the increasing land competition and ambitious land saving targets. Meanwhile, an intensive discussion has begun on how and on which data basis the use of land for settlement and transport can be measured, how qualitative aspects of land use can be included in addition to the official land survey, which role new high-resolution topographic geobase data and building data play in the process of capturing land development potential and how corresponding analysis results can be clearly and comprehensiblely visualized. The present book publication combines current contributions from science and practice in this context. Answers to questions about land survey methods, and further and land monitoring, how to describe selected aspects of land use structure, on the basis of land use, on the basis of land use, on the basis of land use and on the basis of land use, on the basis of land use and on the basis of land use.
content.title_en: Land Use Monitoring IV : more precise data - informed actors - practical action ; [... contributions of the now 4th Dresden Land Use Symposium, which took place from 14 to 15 June 2012 ...]

content.text: Silk in the early and high medieval women's monastery : Possession - Meaning - Re-use ; [Essen's first meeting of the Women's Foundations and the Catholic Academy "The Wolfsburg" from 2 - 4 November 2012]. Valuable silks from Byzantium and Central Asia were exclusive goods, comparable to gold, gems and gems or cameos. In the early and high Middle Ages, precious silks usually only came to the West as gifts and were often given away further due to their value. On this way, the precious goods found their way into the disposal of religious communities also from worldly possessions. On the Mathilden-Otto-Kreuz, Essen's Abbessss Mathilde wears a precious garment. Which material is it about, where does it originate, which message should be conveyed to the viewer with the garment? The ways of such textiles for food let ask for political and cultural relations of the community. A second aspect is the conversion of the precious silks in the Middle Ages.
content.title_en: Silk in the Early and Medieval Women's Penitentiary : Possession - Meaning - Re-use ; [Elfth Conference of the Essen Working Group on the Research of the Women's Pencils and the Catholic Academy "Die Wolfsburg" from 2 - 4 November 2012]

content.text: If the German government has lost its place in the war: social inequality, participation and realization of a right to housing; [... Federal Congress of the Evangelical Homeless Help, which took place in Nuremberg from 17 to 19 November 2012 with the title "Wohnung gut - alles gut?"]. In this volume the access difficulties of people to the general housing market are pointed out. This has no interest in a housing supply for all and obeys other laws. Without living an apartment means not only to be deprived of fundamental rights, but to have to defend itself from diverse prejudices. The marginalized have often to struggle with other cultural backgrounds or with psychological difficulties. Different models of an accompanying consultation for the stabilization of housing conditions are presented as well as forms of cooperation to neighbouring fields of work in the housingless help. The content Political and legal conditions Methodical approaches of a fair housing supply Accompanying advice and cooperation forms in the housingless aid The target groups Dozierde and students of the social, educational and political science of the living aid in the housingless.
content.title_en: If the commodity is lost, social inequality, participation and realization of a right to housing; [... Federal Congress of the Evangelical Homeless Help, which took place in Nuremberg from 17 to 19 November 2012 with the title "Wohnung gut - alles gut?"]

content.text: The late echo of war childhoods: the consequences of the Second World War in life history and history; [on 22 and 23 February 2013 the 2nd International Congress on "Childhoods in Europe in the Second World War" took place in Münster ...]. Delegated experts address the physical, psychological and social burdens of the generation of war children caused by war. Above all, it is about the possible late consequences in old age when childhood and youth were affected by war loads.
content.title_en: The late echo of war childhoods : the consequences of the Second World War in life history and contemporary history ; [on 22 and 23 February 2013 took place in Münster ... the 2nd International Congress on "Childhoods in Europe in the Second World War"]

content.text: Social Media - New Masses : [... 2nd Symposium on Media Studies of the German Research Foundation]. Mass meetings and the positive or negative fantasies of mass are sparked by different discourses and practices of social control, communication and community formation. But masses are no longer what they once were. From the substitution of mass media research by algorithmic analysis of mass data on the diagnosis of dispersed public in the age of social media to new mass ideas such as swarms, flashmobs and multitudes: the emergence, functioning and effects of digital masses are now to be re-examined and negotiated. Moreover, the changes of the present are an option to re-understand the cultural and media history writing of the masses themselves. The volume outlines this new field of research and gathers analyses of the difference between new and old masses, of the different media technical conditions and of the political consequences of current mass phenomena.
content.title_en: Social Media - New Masses : [... 2nd Media Science Symposium of the German Research Foundation]

The overriding thing to do in the past is to get started with the concept of architecture. The overriding thing to do in the past is to get started with the concept of architecture. The overriding thing to do in the past is to get started with the concept of architecture. The overriding thing to do in the past is to get started with the concept of architecture.
content.title_en: What models can do : a small history of the architectural model in contemporary art ; [on the occasion of the exhibition What models can do. A small history of the architectural model in contemporary art, June 29 - October 12 2014, Museum of Contemporary Art Siegen]

content.text: Environment and empirical social and economic research: Contributions and discussion reports to a conference of the project group "The Socio-Economic Panel" at the German Institute for Economic Research. Environmental research and environmental protection are not only the subject of natural sciences, but empirical social and economic sciences and have their important place in this problem area. The corresponding empirical research serves primarily two purposes: firstly, the representation (description) of the environmental state and its evaluation by the population and its subgroups. This branch of environmental social research is in the tradition of social reporting. Secondly, social and economic research surveys serve for behavioural analysis, i.e. the investigation of determinants of environmental-relevant behaviour and the perception of the environment and its evaluation. -- In this volume, an overview of environmental-oriented social and economic research is given in the first block. The second block contains essays, which are in the tradition of social reporting, while in the third block studies are presented, the environmental behaviour is examined microanalytically.
content.title_en: Environment and empirical social and economic research : Contributions and discussion reports to a conference of the project group "The Socio-Economic Panel" at the German Institute for Economic Research

content.text: Manifestations in Design : Design - Architecture - Engineering. "The artifacts developed in the design process, as well as the things of our designed world, are still under-represented in public and scientific attention. The volume deals with the epistemological role of the manifestations arising in design, which make intentions, methods and creative processes readable. The contributions about and from design, architecture and engineering represent an interdisciplinary inventory in order to ask for a new cross-disciplinary perspective of design in the field of tension between analog and digital planning and technization processes."
content.title_en: Manifestations in Design : Design - Architecture - Engineering

content.text: The conference was held in Mannheim on 29 and 30 September 2000 and the discussion of the topic of "Scientific Annual Meeting of the Society for Economic and Social Cybernetics" was held in Mannheim on 29 and 30 September 2000. The discussion of cybernetics, system thinking and complexity management was the result of the often inadequate reality-related formal modeling and analysis of the "classical" methods. As the assumptions of the typical operating research methods were and are difficult to reconcile with the real requirements of decision-making support, especially at the level of corporate policy, this required the search for other ways to deal with the characteristics of relevant real problems in a proper manner. The observation of the dynamics and complexity of corporate management leads almost inevitably to the encounter with cybernetics and system research. Attempts to reduce the arising complexity have proved problematic or even unsuitable. Instead, it is important to build up the necessary activity repertoire to be successful within a complex environment, but also to react. Cybernetics and system research - in particular in the expression of system dynamics - to make the basic concepts to make them more difficult and to make the context of the discussion of the topic of complex systems.
content.title_en: Decisions in complex systems : Scientific Annual Meeting of the Society for Economic and Social Cybernetics, September 29 and 30, 2000 in Mannheim

content.text: The developmental perspectives of low-income countries: On the importance of knowledge and institutions. Knowledge and institutions are important development factors for the so-called low-income countries. What exactly is meant by "knowledge" and "institutions" and what political conclusions to draw - these are the central issues which the Developmental Committee of the Social Policy Association addressed at its Annual Meeting 2000. This volume contains the presentations and correspondents held at this meeting. -- It shows that "knowledge" is important on the one hand in terms of education and human capital. On the other hand, however, special knowledge, such as the effects of macropolitics, centralisation or decentralisation, from privatisation, from regulation to knowledge about the consequences of increased use of information and communication technologies, is important. -- "institutions" are important for the development of low-income countries, on the one hand, from the point of view of how economic, political or social processes are to be organized, so that they have as favourable growth and welfare effects as possible. On the other hand, the well-known question plays a role in ensuring that less of qualitative optimism is to the development, and the extent of the institution to be more concretely of knowledge.
content.title_en: Development prospects of low-income countries: on the importance of knowledge and institutions

content.text: Indeterminate signatures of technology: a new interpretation of the technological world. Not that a fundamental uncertainty has not always been part of life or a more or less constant and universal condition of human existence, appears as a problem, but - that with the experience of an increase in uncertainty a technology connected with society is affected by it and involved in the uncertainty process; - that social freedom and option gains go hand in hand with after-sustaining loss of orientation; - that the technoscientific generation of knowledge brings forth novel zones of non-knowledge; - that we cannot know what we should actually do and - that dealing with this fact is the starting condition for a contemporary-incontinuous philosophy of technology. The contributions of this volume (including Dreyfus, Dupuy, Hörning, Hubig, Nordmann and Willke) are not only based on the different aspects of this development. They also make an attempt to estimate the socio-technical determination and the radical strategies of union (the self-evidentialization) in the new task of a "requiretly determined world.
content.title_en: Indeterminability signatures of technology: a new interpretation of the technological world
