content.text: The Koran and its religious and cultural environment. In research, the Koran is too often regarded as a text sufficient for itself. From this point of view, the participants of the colloquium on the Koran, organized at the Historical College in May 2006, freed themselves from this view.
content.title_en: The Koran and its religious and cultural environment

content.text: Palatium Sacrum : Sacredness at the Court of the Middle Ages : Places, Things, Rituals. Cross-section of current research on the religious culture of the medieval court. Fundamental studies on a hitherto neglected aspect of pre-modern residence research in a perspective extending beyond Europe. 'The volume combines 17 contributions from an international conference held at the University of Göttingen from 18-20 June 2015. He raises the question of the manifestations and practices of the sacred in pre-modern courts, whether in buildings, objects or rituals. The focus of a cross-cultural discourse is the post-antique palace with its religious places and zones, but also other forms of cultic tabooization and sanctioning, in which the border between "profan" and "sacral" is often difficult to determine. The temporal framework ranges from antiquity to the late Middle Ages, the cultural spectrum from Western Europe and Byzantineism to the Islamic courts in Syria and Al-Andalus.'
content.title_en: Palatium Sacrum : Sacredness at the court of the Middle Ages : Places, things, rituals

content.text: Making Heimat. Germany arrival country : atlas of refugees housing : Refugee building atlas. The refugee situation in autumn 2015 was the starting point for the strongly discussed exhibition Making Heimat. Germany, Arrival Country at the German Pavilion at the 15th Architecture Biennale 2016 in Venice. The refugee building atlas expands the considerations about the German arrival cities from the first volume. What role do architects and city planners play in the implementation of sustainable solutions for the accommodation of new arrivals in Germany? Which construction projects can serve as prototypes for affordable housing? Using about 55 construction projects, a look into the future of the German cities is ventured. Photographs by Anja Weber and detailed project presentations, which were created after visits on site, provide insights into the everyday life of German refugee accommodation
content.title_en: Making Heimat. Germany arrival country : atlas of refugees housing : Refugee Building Atlas

content.text: Housing for everyone?! : Perspectives on planning, politics and architecture. Rents and housing prices have been rising for years - especially in growing cities and regions of Germany. Cheap housing is increasingly scarce and low and medium income groups are burdened by high housing costs.0The volume brings creative, social and political solutions into a dialogue. The contributions explore the reasons for the return of the housing question and present strategies with which affordable housing can be created for all. Actors from science, practice, politics and social movements find current perspectives on an urgent urban problem here.
content.title_en: Living space for all?! : Perspectives on planning, politics and architecture

content.text: The consumer city: Consumers in the city of the Middle Ages. "For modern urban history research, the re-appropriation of Max Weber's considerations on the type of occidental city has proved particularly inspiring. In contrast, it is less present that in the debates of the period around 1900 the economic aspect of the city concept has been of very considerable importance. This connection can be read at Max Weber's work. Werner Sombart is also more clearly depicted in his work, which assigns consumers a central role to urban development and development towards producers and distance traders. This collection examines the profitability of consumer-historical concepts and refers them to current problems connected with medieval city history." (Verlagsinformation)
content.title_en: The Consumer City : Consumers in the City of the Middle Ages
